title: Do Jewish people and Levantine Arabs both originate from Canaanites or were the Jews a separate people living in the same area? - Quora

response.answer_text: Levantine Arabs originated mostly from Greeks who settled there after expulsion of Jews. (Read Josephus Flavius). They have very little if any connection to Canaanites or Jews. Later Arabs, Crusaders and African Muslims added to their pool. Jews are one of the Canaanite tribes (mostly). Where other Canaanites disappeared? To the same place other ancient people: Babylonians, Sumerians, Mitanni, Urartu and many more went.

Only Levantine Palestinians originate from Canaan, including Palestinan Jews, Christians and Muslims. The Jews of Palestine converted to Christianity during the Roman occupation of the region and both Christians and Jews converted to Islam in the 7th century CE. So by the end of 7th century the majority of the Palestinians were Muslims.

Judaism began in the hill country outside Jerusalem among Canaanites. Their neighbors were Canaanites except for Philistine arrivals on the coast (who assimilated over time genetically). The Muslim invasion would bring some new DNA from the Arabian peninsula and elsewhere; you can find DNA results by country on wikipedia.
Graham Raha has disabled comments.Thus I am responding this way.Actually,Graham,Ashkenazi Jews are mostly of Levantine origin with some southern European admixtures.

Levantine Arabs (Lebanese, Syrian, Palestinian, Jordanian) and Jews (Mizrahi) both originate from Canaanites. Ashkenazi Jews have European ancestry, but part of their genomes are of Canaanite or Levantine origin.
